section.title: Narrative tenses
section.sectiontitle: Use the Past Simple to talk about completed actions in the past.
section.text1a: We got up early and caught the 11 o'clock train.
section.text2a: I liked him the moment I saw him.
section.sectiontitle2: Use the Past Continuous to talk about actions in progress at a particular time in the past. Use was or were + present participle.
section.text3a: I was walking to work when I tripped and fell.
section.text4a: She met her husband while they were living in Canada.

section.title: Narrative tenses
section.sectiontitle: Use the Past Perfect Simple to talk about completed actions that happened before another action in the past. Use had + past participle.
section.text1a: I'd just finished my lunch when the doorbell rang.
section.text2a: As soon as he got to the airport, he realised he had forgotten his passport.
section.sectiontitle2: Use the Past Perfect Continuous to talk about actions or situations which continued up to the past moment we are talking about. Use had + been + present participle.
section.text3a: Before they moved to this country, they had been living in Australia.
section.text4a: I'd been travelling for several weeks when I finally arrived in Machu Picchu.
